item.title: Afghanistan war: Taliban back brutal rule as they strike for power
item.description: Afghanistan's ex-rulers still back brutal punishments, the BBC finds as it goes behind Taliban lines.

item.title: Afghanistan war: Army chief replaced as Taliban seize more cities
item.description: General Wali Mohammad Ahmadzai is removed from his post, as the insurgents take more cities.

item.title: Wagner: Scale of Russian mercenary mission in Libya exposed
item.description: A Samsung tablet obtained by the BBC unveils chilling details of how mercenaries fought in Libyaâ€™s war.

item.title: Briton suspected of spying for Russia arrested in Germany
item.description: German federal prosecutors say the British man passed documents to Russian intelligence for cash.

item.title: Algeria forest fires: At least 65 people killed as fires spread
item.description: At least 65 people have been killed as the fires continue to spread amid an intense heatwave.

item.title: Johnny Depp's film festival awards insulting, domestic abuse charities say
item.description: The actor, labelled a "wife beater" by The Sun, is to be honoured in Spain and the Czech Republic.

item.title: Instagram launches 'limits' to hide abusive messages
item.description: Instagram launches a feature to automatically hide most comments during "spikes" of abuse.

item.title: Hackers steal $600m in major cryptocurrency heist
item.description: Thousands of digital tokens have been stolen by hackers in one of the largest cryptocurrency heists.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Some Australian Olympians face 28-day quarantine
item.description: Some Australians Olympians are having to quarantine for 28 days after returning to their country from Tokyo

item.title: Google may cut pay of staff who work from home
item.description: The tech giant has developed a calculator that lets staff see the effects of remote working.

item.title: Kinnaur: At least 10 dead and dozens trapped in India landslide
item.description: Boulders fall on a Himalayan highway, killing at least 10 people and trapping many more.

item.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro defeated over printed ballot proposal
item.description: A plan by President Bolsonaro to switch to printed ballots fails to get enough support in Congress.

item.title: Afghanistan: The people fleeing the north for safety in Kabul
item.description: The Taliban has taken new territories in the north, forcing thousands out of their homes.

item.title: Kathy Hochul: Who is New York's first female governor?
item.description: The history-making Democrat will take the role after Andrew Cuomo resigned over harassment claims.

item.title: Fenty Beauty: How make-up helped Rihanna become a billionaire
item.description: Rihanna makes more money from her make-up than from her music and acting work.

item.title: Wildfires: How are they linked to climate change?
item.description: A series of major wildfires across the world has hit the headlines - how do they compare to previous years?

item.title: Zambia election: Young voters may hold the cards
item.description: Zambia will vote on Thursday amid growing concern about high unemployment and inflation.

item.title: Infrastructure bill: $1tn for clean energy, internet, trains and more
item.description: The $1tn bill takes aim at issues from buckling bridges to global warming and remote working.

item.title: Olympic medals: An alternative table - with US 15th
item.description: How would the medals table look if population and wealth were taken into account?

item.title: Afghanistan: Why is there a war?
item.description: As foreign forces pull out after 20 years of war, what did it achieve and what happens next?

item.title: Why South Korean women are reclaiming their short hair
item.description: Thousands proudly show off their short hair after an Olympic athlete is criticised for her haircut.

item.title: The illegal gold mines killing rivers and livelihoods in Ghana
item.description: Sixty percent of Ghana's water bodies are now polluted, largely due to illegal mining operations.

item.title: Cuomo resigns as New York governor
item.description: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo announces his resignation after sexual harassment inquiry.

item.title: Lithuania blames Belarus for migrant crisis
item.description: Over 4,000 people are reported to have crossed in Lithuania in recent months.

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban seizure will challenge West - Gen Sir Nick Carter
item.description: The chief of the defence staff on difficulties ahead if the Taliban illegitimately seize control.

item.title: Fashion photographer: 'The world doesn't see this part of Afghanistan'
item.description: Fatimah Hossaini is a fashion photographer in Afghanistan and wants to use her work to help women be seen.
